definition: position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: None of these people resigned from office.
sentences.chinese: 这些人没有一个辞去了官位。

sentences.english: Finally, the final conclusion she could explain her position when the great.
sentences.chinese: 她能最后定论，说明她当的官位很大。

sentences.english: However, there are also some leaders who dare not to talk much in order that their official position are safe.
sentences.chinese: 当然，也有部分领袖为了保住本身的官位而不敢呛声。

sentences.english: He was to leave about their position before the "gourd".
sentences.chinese: 他是为了自己的官位才乱放“葫芦”的。

sentences.english: Wide bright gate has only official can use times of grade curtilage .
sentences.chinese: 广亮大门只有有官位品级的宅第方可使用。

sentences.english: Although it was a very high position, he graciously refused it.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这个官位很高，但他还是婉言拒绝了。

sentences.english: After that, Zhao Gao, through intrigue, killed the prime minister and took over his post.
sentences.chinese: 然后，赵高耍阴谋杀死了宰相，夺走了他的官位。

sentences.english: I think Iam the right person for the job you advertised.
sentences.chinese: 相信我是你们招聘的官位的最好人选。

definition: an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
